de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.distance.distancefunction

Interface DistanceFunction<O>

  • Type Parameters:
    O - Object type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClusteringDistanceSimilarityFunction, DBIDDistanceFunction, DBIDRangeDistanceFunction, DimensionSelectingSubspaceDistanceFunction<O>, IndexBasedDistanceFunction<O>, Norm<O>, NumberVectorDistanceFunction<O>, PrimitiveDistanceFunction<O>, SpatialPrimitiveDistanceFunction<V>, WeightedNumberVectorDistanceFunction<V>

WeightedPearsonCorrelationDistanceFunction, WeightedSquaredEuclideanDistanceFunction, WeightedSquaredPearsonCorrelationDistanceFunction

    public interface DistanceFunction<O>
    Base interface for any kind of distances.
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    Erich Schubert

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TypeInformation getInputTypeRestriction()
      Get the input data type of the function.
      <T extends O>
      DistanceQuery<T>      		 instantiate(Relation<T> relation)
      Instantiate with a database to get the actual distance query.
      default boolean isMetric()
      Is this distance function metric (satisfy the triangle inequality)
      default boolean isSquared()
      Squared distances, that would become metric after square root.
      default boolean isSymmetric()
      Is this function symmetric?

    • Method Detail

      • isSymmetric

        default boolean isSymmetric()
        Is this function symmetric?
        Returns:
        true when symmetric

      • isMetric

        default boolean isMetric()
        Is this distance function metric (satisfy the triangle inequality)
        Returns:
        true when metric.

      • isSquared

        default boolean isSquared()
        Squared distances, that would become metric after square root. E.g. squared Euclidean.
        Returns:
        true when squared.

      • getInputTypeRestriction

        TypeInformation getInputTypeRestriction()
        Get the input data type of the function.
        Returns:
        Type restriction

      • instantiate

        <T extends O> DistanceQuery<T> instantiate(Relation<T> relation)
        Instantiate with a database to get the actual distance query.
        Parameters:
        relation - The representation to use
        Returns:
        Actual distance query.
